sentence.Network_en: This is the claptrap that politicians have peddled many times before.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是政客们宣扬过无数次的废话。
不要相信政客说的空话.

list.abs: Don ' t believe that political claptrap ., 不要相信政客说的空话.
for decades politicians had mouthed their support for a strong currency , but nixon cut through the claptrap .数十年来，政客们曾装腔作势地支持强势美元，但尼克松百般地削减美元价值。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent. (denoting something designed to elicit applause): from clap + trap

entry.tran: 夸夸其谈;哗众取宠的空谈；蠢话
entry.def: If you describe something that someone says as claptrap, you mean that it is stupid or foolish although it may sound important.

example.ex: This is the claptrap that politicians have peddled many times before.
example.tran: 这是政客们宣扬过无数次的废话。

means.word_mean: 1. pompous or pretentious talk or writing

auth_sentence.content: This is the sort of sentimental claptrap that undermines practically every evironmental issue.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is the sort of sentimental claptrap that undermines practically every evironmental issue.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is the sort of sentimental claptrap that undermines practically every evironmental issue.

auth_sentence.content: That's why I said it was pointless to keep responding to your claptrap.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: That's why I said it was pointless to keep responding to your claptrap.
